articles.headline: Senate Braces for Health Showdown With McCain on Hand but a Plan Unclear
articles.snippet: After months of deliberation, Republicans have reached the moment when they have to vote. But they still don’t know what exactly they’ll be voting on.
articles.abstract: After months of deliberation, Republicans have reached the moment when they have to vote. But they still don’t know what exactly they’ll be voting on.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Senate Republican leaders, keeping alive their push to dismantle the Affordable Care Act, are barreling toward a showdown vote on Tuesday to begin debating a repeal of the health law. And Senator John McCain announced Monday night that he will be on hand to cast his vote, despite a diagnosis of brain cancer.
articles.byline: By Thomas Kaplan and Julie Hirschfeld Davis

articles.headline: Democrats Try to Find Economic Message After Railing Against Trump
articles.snippet: Democrats gathered in a small town in Virginia on Monday to unveil the economic themes they hope to run on in 2018 as they look beyond President Trump.
articles.abstract: Democrats gathered in a small town in Virginia on Monday to unveil the economic themes they hope to run on in 2018 as they look beyond President Trump.
articles.lead_paragraph: BERRYVILLE, Va. — For more than a year, Democrats have raged against now-President Trump, projecting their opposition as the party’s central message. In so doing, they have maintained their minority status in Congress, sustained the most stunning loss in modern presidential history and left voters with little sense of what they represent.
articles.byline: By Matt Flegenheimer and Alexander Burns

articles.headline: China’s HNA Discloses Shift of Ownership Stake to Foundation
articles.snippet: The privately held conglomerate, which has gone on an overseas acquisition spree, sought to address concerns about its ownership structure.
articles.abstract: The privately held conglomerate, which has gone on an overseas acquisition spree, sought to address concerns about its ownership structure.
articles.lead_paragraph: The acquisitive Chinese conglomerate HNA Group moved to allay concerns about its ownership structure on Monday by releasing a statement showing that its biggest shareholder had recently shifted from a mysterious businessman to a foundation it set up in New York.

articles.headline: Economy Needs Workers, but Drug Tests Take a Toll
articles.snippet: Employers say they are having trouble filling jobs because too many applicants can’t pass screening, a factor depressing the labor participation rate.
articles.abstract: Employers say they are having trouble filling jobs because too many applicants can’t pass screening, a factor depressing the labor participation rate.
articles.lead_paragraph: YOUNGSTOWN, Ohio — Just a few miles from where President Trump will address his blue-collar base here Tuesday night, exactly the kind of middle-class factory jobs he has vowed to bring back from overseas are going begging.

articles.headline: Scaramucci on Trump: ‘He’s My Client’
articles.snippet: The new White House communications director is just as brash as his boss — and, it seems, just as willing to kiss and make up with a former foe.
articles.abstract: The new White House communications director is just as brash as his boss — and, it seems, just as willing to kiss and make up with a former foe.
articles.lead_paragraph: Here’s the thing about the Mooch: When he sets a goal for himself, he somehow seems to find a way to accomplish it.

articles.headline: In Trump’s World, ‘Very Weak’ Sessions Twists in Wind
articles.snippet: The president’s unforgiving campaign against his own attorney general opens rift with the right and leaves White House at war with the Justice Department.
articles.abstract: The president’s unforgiving campaign against his own attorney general opens rift with the right and leaves White House at war with the Justice Department.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In the annals of cutthroat Washington politics, it would be hard to find a cabinet secretary left abandoned and humiliated in the way President Trump has left Attorney General Jeff Sessions.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker, Jeremy W. Peters and Rebecca R. Ruiz
